rev.comment: being open to donations is not "making heavy investments in bitcoin", but this could be placed somewhere else
rev.diff:
Line 145: Line 145:
==Adoption==
==Adoption==
â
[[Wikileaks]],<ref>http://wikileaks.org/support.html</ref><ref>http://twitter.com/#!/wikileaks/status/80774521350668288</ref><ref>http://blogs.forbes.com/andygreenberg/2011/06/14/wikileaks-asks-for-anonymous-bitcoin-donations/</ref> the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]]{{citation needed|date=June 2011}}, [[Free Software Foundation]],<ref>http://www.fsf.org/blogs/community/bitcoins-a-new-way-to-donate-to-the-fsf</ref> [[Freenet]]<ref>https://freenetproject.org/donate.html</ref>, [[Pioneer One]],<ref>http://twitter.com/#!/pioneeronetv/status/36119594439544832</ref> [[Silk Road (anonymous marketplace)]],<ref>http://gawker.com/5805928/the-underground-website-where-you-can-buy-any-drug-imaginable</ref><ref>http://www.smh.com.au/technology/technology-news/drugs-bought-with-virtual-cash-20110611-1fy0a.html</ref> and several others<ref>https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Donation-accepting_organizations_and_projects</ref> already accept donations in Bitcoin. This in spite of Gavin Andresen, one of the 'core developers', explicitly advising people "not to make heavy investments in Bitcoins".<ref>{{cite episode | title=/59/Bitcoin - a Digital, Decentralized Currency (at 31 min.)| series=omega tau podcast | url=http://omegataupodcast.net/2011/03/59-bitcoin-a-digital-decentralized-currency/ | airdate=19 March 2011}}</ref>
+
[[Wikileaks]],<ref>http://wikileaks.org/support.html</ref><ref>http://twitter.com/#!/wikileaks/status/80774521350668288</ref><ref>http://blogs.forbes.com/andygreenberg/2011/06/14/wikileaks-asks-for-anonymous-bitcoin-donations/</ref> the [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]]{{citation needed|date=June 2011}}, [[Free Software Foundation]],<ref>http://www.fsf.org/blogs/community/bitcoins-a-new-way-to-donate-to-the-fsf</ref> [[Freenet]]<ref>https://freenetproject.org/donate.html</ref>, [[Pioneer One]],<ref>http://twitter.com/#!/pioneeronetv/status/36119594439544832</ref> [[Silk Road (anonymous marketplace)]],<ref>http://gawker.com/5805928/the-underground-website-where-you-can-buy-any-drug-imaginable</ref><ref>http://www.smh.com.au/technology/technology-news/drugs-bought-with-virtual-cash-20110611-1fy0a.html</ref> and several others<ref>https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Donation-accepting_organizations_and_projects</ref> already accept donations in Bitcoin.
